alert.note: Alert for Carter; Garvin; Johnston; Murray; Pontotoc (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 22 at 4:00AM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Johnston, east central Garvin, southeastern Carter, southwestern Pontotoc and Murray Counties through 430 AM CST... At 400 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Springer, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ardmore, Sulphur, Davis, Lone Grove, Dickson, Roff, Springer, Mill Creek, Fitzhugh, Dougherty, Gene Autry, Hickory, Fittstown, Vanoss, Lake Of The Arbuckles, Turner Falls, Scullin, Overbrook, Pontotoc and northwestern Lake Murray. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 25 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
